intro: Acropterygium pectinatum var. sublineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acropterygium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
